document_content.title: Referral to Internal Medicine for Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jessica Thornton is being referred to Internal Medicine for evaluation of persistent fatigue and generalized malaise ongoing for the past 3 months. Symptoms have not improved with initial primary care management.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports experiencing increasing fatigue, low energy, and mild headaches since February 2025. There is no significant weight change, fever, or night sweats. She denies chest pain, palpitations, or shortness of breath. No recent travel or sick contacts.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic medical conditions. No previous surgeries. No history of anemia or thyroid disorder.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasional acetaminophen for headaches. No regular prescription medications.

sections.heading: Family and Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker. Drinks alcohol occasionally. Works as a graphic designer. No family history of autoimmune or chronic diseases.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vitals stable. Physical examination unremarkable except for mild pallor. No lymphadenopathy or organomegaly.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent blood work showed mild microcytic anemia (Hb 10.9 g/dL, MCV 78 fL). Thyroid function tests within normal limits. Renal and liver function normal.

sections.heading: Request
sections.content: Kindly evaluate for underlying causes of fatigue and anemia. Further investigations and management recommendations would be appreciated.
